channel.title: EU General Court on 0x000216
channel.description: Recent content in EU General Court on 0x000216

item.title: ClientEarth v Council: A significant win for transparency in accessing documents.
item.description:
Dimitrios Kyriazis (DPhil, Oxon), Assistant Professor in EU Law at the Law School of the Aristotle University of Thessaloniki. Photo credit: Bela Geletneky, via Wikimedia Commons In the combined cases of ClientEarth v Council (T-682/21 and T-683/21), the General Court of the European Union (GC) reviewed a challenge brought by ClientEarth AISBL and Ms. Leino-Sandberg against the Council of the EU. The applicants sought to overturn the Council’s decision to withhold access to documents they had requested under the Public Access to Documents Regulation and the Aarhus Convention Regulation...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/clientearth-v-council-a-significant-win-for-transparency-in-accessing-documents/

item.title: Insights from interim proceedings: Amazon v DSA
item.description:
Laureline Lemoine, Senior Associate, AWO Agency Photo credit: KarleHorn, via Wikimedia Commons A recent legal challenge to the Digital Services Act (DSA) provides insight into how Amazon is approaching its obligations under the new law. The case, initiated by Amazon after being designated a Very Large Online Platform (VLOP), centers around two main arguments. First, Amazon contests the DSA requirement for an opt-out for recommender systems based on user profiling (Article 38), claiming it would negatively impact its business and users...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/insights-from-interim-proceedings-amazon-v-dsa/

item.title: The Advocate General's Opinion in Grupa Azoty once again exposes a significant deficiency in EU judicial protection, but fails to address the issue.
item.description:
Professor Geert van Calster, University of Leuven Photo credit: Wojciech Antosz, via Wikimedia Commons Executive summary: In early March, Advocate General Pikam√§e issued an opinion in the case of Grupa Azoty S.A. et al v European Commission (Joined Cases C 73/22P and C 77/22 P). This case is an appeal concerning the ability to partially overturn the European Commission’s 2020 “Guidelines on certain State aid measures in the context of the system for greenhouse gas emission allowance trading post-2021...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-advocate-general-s-opinion-in-grupa-azoty-once-again-exposes-a-significant-deficiency-in-eu-judicial-protection-but-fails-to-address-the-issue/

item.title: Responsibility in Joint Returns after WS and Others v Frontex: Letting the Active By-Stander Off the Hook
item.description:
A Missed Opportunity for Accountability: Examining the General Court’s Ruling in WS and others v Frontex This analysis delves into the General Court’s September 6, 2023, decision in the case of WS and others v Frontex, where a Syrian refugee family’s claim for damages against Frontex was dismissed. The family, seeking refuge in the EU during the Syrian war, was returned to Turkey under questionable circumstances involving a joint return operation between Greece and Frontex...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/responsibility-in-joint-returns-after-ws-and-others-v-frontex-letting-the-active-by-stander-off-the-hook/

item.title: The EU General Court's ruling in the WS and Others v Frontex case: Failure to hold accountable human rights violations at EU external borders.
item.description:
Francesca Romana Partipilo, PhD candidate in International Law at Sant’Anna School of Advanced Studies (Pisa) Photo credit: Rock Cohen, via Wikimedia commons (see also critique of the judgment, by Melanie Fink and Jorrit Rijpma) On September 6th, the EU General Court dismissed a case brought by a Syrian family claiming material and emotional damages from Frontex. They alleged experiencing anguish, fear, and suffering due to Frontex’s actions during a return operation conducted jointly with Greece on October 20th, 2016...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-eu-general-court-s-ruling-in-the-ws-and-others-v-frontex-case-failure-to-hold-accountable-human-rights-violations-at-eu-external-borders/
